# Danwar language

| date             = 2011 census
| ref              = e18
| familycolor      = Indo-European
| fam2             = Indo-Iranian
| fam3             = Indo-Aryan
| fam4             = Eastern Zone (Magadhan)
| fam5             = Bihari
| fam6             = (unclassified)
| lc1              = dhw
| ld1              = Dhanwar
| glotto           = dhan1265
| glottoname       = -Done Danuwar
| glotto2          = koch1253
| glottoname2      = Kochariya-East Danuwar
| ethnicity        = Danuwar people
}}
Danuwar (also rendered Danwar, Denwar, Dhanvar, Dhanwar) is a language spoken in parts of Nepal by Danuwar ethnic group. It is close to Bote-Darai and Tharu languages but otherwise unclassified within the Indo-Aryan languages.
